intro: Rubus × elegantulus, commonly known as the elegant blackberry, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along hedgerows. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and agricultural settings.
